basis: User consumed a substantial lunch (quinoa bowl with veggies and chicken, plus yogurt and apple) and reported feeling 4/5 full; no indication of overeating or skipping; the action aligns closely with S = 4.04.
cognitive_dissonance: No explicit internal conflict expressed; user describes a calm decision process (paused to breathe before deciding whether to have more).
negative_thought_patterns: Minimal; no self-blame or all-or-nothing thinking evident; stress is described as a trigger rather than a source of guilt.
emotional_triggers: Work-related stress preceding the meal acts as an emotional trigger; stress led to a pause rather than impulsive additional eating.
coaching_notes: Maintain a supportive, nonjudgmental tone; reinforce the value of the breathing pause and fullness cues; encourage explicit reflection on whether to have more after a pause; set small post-meal check-in goals (e.g., note fullness and stress level, plan for the next snack if needed).
